constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 42 (Wednesday, March 9, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. MALLIOTAKIS:
H.R. 7034.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2:
The Congress shall have Power to dispose of and make all
needful Rules and Regulations respecting the Territory or
other Property belonging to the United States
[Page H1424]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

title: To rename the portions of the Gateway National Seashore located on Staten Island, New York, as the "Senator James L. Buckley National Seashore".
